result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro in court with attorney James J. Connolly.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:
Calvin B.

The COurt sentenced the defendant to 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 16 days with Huber release for work, school and AODA treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-60 days in the House of Correction, STAYED for use by the agent
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-Absolute sobriety with randon urine tests
-AODA treatment and any recommended treatment
-20 hours of community service
-Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment
-work/school at least part time
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral modification course
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/22/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/22/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconvicitn Relief
Filed, Ileligible Voting and Acknowledgement
Defense Sentencing Recommendation received and filed.

Defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro in court with attorney James J. Connolly.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 10/22/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Case calendared for PROECTED PLEA on 9/24/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro not in court.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk;ds

 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  William Levins for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Lisa Marie Conigliaro in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-12-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
